text: Afdiharto Mardi Lestari (born 19 January 1968, in Binjai) is a retired Indonesian athlete who competed in sprinting events. His biggest success was reaching the semifinals in the 100 metres at the 1988 Summer Olympics in Seoul. In addition, he won multiple medals on regional level. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1986 |Asian Junior Championships |Jakarta, Indonesia |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |100 m |10.53 |- |rowspan=2|1987 |Asian Championships |Singapore |4th |100 m | |- |Southeast Asian Games |Jakarta, Indonesia |bgcolor=silver|2nd |100 m |10.49 |- |rowspan=2|1988 |rowspan=2|Olympic Games |rowspan=2|Seoul, South Korea |13th (sf) |100 m |10.39 |- | – |4 × 100 m relay |DNF |- |rowspan=3|1989 |World Cup |Barcelona, Spain |8th |100 m |10.481 |- |rowspan=2|Southeast Asian Games |rowspan=2|Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia |bgcolor=gold|1st |100 m | |- |bgcolor=gold|1st |200 m | |- |1991 |Southeast Asian Games |Manila, Philippines |bgcolor=gold|1st |100 m | |- |1993 |Southeast Asian Games |Singapore |bgcolor=gold|1st |100 m | |} 1Representing Asia ==Personal bests== Outdoor *100 metres – 10.20 (Jakarta 1989) *200 metres – 21.00 (+1.1 m/s, Kuala Lumpur 1989) ==References== *All-Athletics profile Category:1968 births Category:Living people Category:People from Binjai Category:Indonesian male sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of Indonesia Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from North Sumatra Category:Southeast Asian Games medalists in athletics Category:Southeast Asian Games gold medalists for Indonesia Category:Southeast Asian Games silver medalists for Indonesia Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1994 Asian Games Category:Competitors at the 1987 Southeast Asian Games Category:Competitors at the 1989 Southeast Asian Games Category:Competitors at the 1991 Southeast Asian Games Category:Competitors at the 1993 Southeast Asian Games Category:Asian Games competitors for Indonesia
